intro: Lisianthius scandens, commonly known as the climbing lisianthius, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows as a vine, climbing or trailing along structures with its opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. It prefers full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
